<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 299, 155, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/22 October/November 2019 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 420, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 437, 374]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 406]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 431]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 320, 445]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 445, 504, 460]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 384, 489]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 282, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 545, 599, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 604, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 606, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 600, 759, 615]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 615, 440, 629]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 73, 594, 88]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 164, 559, 181]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 195, 233, 212]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 371, 243]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0,\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[423, 245, 574, 284]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 315, 222, 331]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 336, 745, 375]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 381, 480, 420]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 483, 591, 501]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 516, 153, 532]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 545, 578, 612]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 235, 660]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 666, 590, 700]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 718, 590, 777]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 70, 96, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 601, 89]]<|/det|>
On each of the Venn diagrams below, shade the region indicated.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 100, 690, 275]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 272, 566, 291]]<|/det|>
\[(A^{\prime}\cap B)\cup (A\cap B^{\prime})\]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 316, 690, 485]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 489, 544, 508]]<|/det|>
\[(A\cap B)\cup C\]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 533, 690, 707]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[458, 705, 541, 724]]<|/det|>
<form>\(A \cap B \cap C'\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 721, 920, 740]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 85, 92, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 79, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = 2\sin 3x + \cos 3x\), show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} +\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} +3y = k\sin 3x\), where \(k\) is a constant to be determined.  [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 536, 91]]<|/det|>
A 5-digit code is formed using the following characters.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 102, 520, 120]]<|/det|>
Letters a e i o u

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 117, 520, 135]]<|/det|>
Numbers 1 2 3 4 5 6

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 133, 448, 152]]<|/det|>
Symbols \(@ * \#\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 692, 183]]<|/det|>
No character can be repeated in a code. Find the number of possible codes if

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 196, 144, 214]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 339, 214]]<|/det|>
there are no restrictions,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 197, 920, 215]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 427, 141, 445]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 427, 725, 445]]<|/det|>
the code starts with a symbol followed by two letters and then two numbers,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 428, 920, 446]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[104, 660, 141, 679]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 660, 740, 679]]<|/det|>
the first two characters are numbers, and no other numbers appear in the code.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 660, 920, 679]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 828, 95]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the line \(y = kx + 3\) does not meet the curve \(y = x^{2} + 5x + 12\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 757, 104]]<|/det|>
At the point where \(x = 1\) on the curve \(y = \frac{k}{(x + 1)^2}\), the normal has a gradient of \(\frac{1}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 109, 143, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 109, 398, 129]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 420, 141, 439]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 420, 725, 440]]<|/det|>
Using your value of \(k\), find the equation of the tangent to the curve at \(x = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 420, 920, 439]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 79, 141, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 763, 104]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\tan x}{1 + \sec x} + \frac{1 + \sec x}{\tan x} = 1 + 3 \sin x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 97]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx - 40 = 0\) has three positive integer roots. Two of the roots are 2 and 4. Find the other root and the value of each of the integers \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 432, 146, 450]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
A particle \(A\) travels with a speed of \(6.5 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) in the direction \(- 5\mathbf{i} - 12\mathbf{j}\) . Find the velocity, \(\pmb{v}_{A}\) , of \(A\) . [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 211, 143, 230]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 210, 734, 231]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 212, 920, 230]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 350, 920, 386]]<|/det|>
Particle \(A\) starts moving from the point with position vector \(20\mathbf{i} - 7\mathbf{j}\). At the same time particle \(B\) starts moving from the point with position vector \(- 67\mathbf{i} + 11\mathbf{j}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[104, 396, 141, 416]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 396, 920, 416]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 318, 920, 354]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 365, 143, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 841, 384]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 365, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 658, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
Solve the quadratic equation \(\left(\sqrt{5} - 3\right)x^{2} + 3x + \left(\sqrt{5} +3\right) = 0\), giving your answers in the form \(a + b\sqrt{5}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. [6]
